FuncDef:
The parent-priority weight command configures a scheduling weight for a specified parent scheduler in a user queue profile.
The undo parent-priority weight command restores the default scheduling weight for a specified parent scheduler in a user queue profile.
By default, the scheduling weight of a parent scheduler in a user queue profile is 10.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a parent scheduler.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3.

Specifies a parent scheduler.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In WFQ scheduling mode, a parent scheduler schedules traffic in user queues based on scheduling weights. If traffic congestion occurs, the scheduler schedules the service traffic of users based on the weight ratio between user queues. In the user queue profile view, you can run this command to set a scheduling weight for a specified parent scheduler. If no scheduling weight is set, the parent scheduler schedules traffic based on the default weight.
Precautions
A scheduling weight takes effect only when the scheduling mode of a parent scheduler is WFQ.
